messages.message: the OCR app in the “review batch” view shows me one index per page, but all the files and ibocr files per index are of the entire document (i.e. all the pages) instead of 0-th index corresponding to 1st page, 1-th index corresponding to 2nd page, etc.
if you have ideas on how to make this clearer, all for adding that to the product!
basically, we go Process Files (any file -> text version of file)
then we go Map Records (file -> record)
everything downstream we operate on is a record, which means that the Review Batch is showing you information per record
so if you chose Map Records to be per page, then each record would be a page
if you did "Per Document" then there would only be one record corresponding to the entire document

Aah cool — yea that make sense conceptually, but I must be doing something wrong then. I have map records set to “Split by page” and am looking at out/s2_map_records at index 0 and index 1, the PDFs are identical (not the 1st and 2nd page respectively).
the flow in question is located here in case you can access it directly: https://www.instabase.com/apps/flow/edit/chetan/my-repo/fs/Instabase%20Drive/image%20rotation/workflows/hello%20world.ibflow#
This is probably a UI bug. If you right click on the ibocr file and choose to open it with `Refiner`, you should see each record as a row in Refiner
That is a limitation of our Review OCR page. We currently don't split the PDFs in the display according to which pages in the document it represents
As Kerry is saying, the record text should definitely be different
But the PDF itself is the same when you look at it under the Review page
cool — makes sense, just wanted to confirm I wasn’t doing something wrong.
